<script>WH.desktopAds.addQuizAd('quizad2')</script>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Gluten-Free_Chocolate_Cake_2_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>5</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Gluten-Free_Chocolate_Cake_2">Gluten-Free Chocolate Cake</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_5">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-33.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-33.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 33" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-33.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-33.jpg" height="485" id="img_fb562112a3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fb562112a3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 33" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-33.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-33.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare to make the cake.</b> Preheat oven to 350° degrees Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. Grease and flour a 9-inch square pan.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-34.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-34.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 34" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-34.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-34.jpg" height="485" id="img_270040eecc" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_270040eecc')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 34" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-34.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-34.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Combine the dry ingredients.</b> In a large bowl, mix the gluten-free flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, and xanthan gum. Stir with a whisk until well-combined.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-35.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-35.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 35" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-35.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-35.jpg" height="485" id="img_e01634567c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e01634567c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 35" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-35.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-35.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add the wet ingredients.</b> Pour in the cooking oil, vinegar, vanilla extract, water, and egg. Mix well with the whisk or use a hand-mixer and blend until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-36.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-36.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 36" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-36.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-36.jpg" height="485" id="img_dbe7c6da7f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_dbe7c6da7f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 36" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-36.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-36.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pour the batter into the pan.</b> Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-37.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-37.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 37" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-37.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-37.jpg" height="485" id="img_f0e1c8e612" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f0e1c8e612')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 37" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-37.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-37.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Bake the cake.</b> Place the cake pan in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 30-35 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-38-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-38-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 38" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-38-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-38-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_63ac79054b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_63ac79054b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 38" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-38-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-38-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Let the cake cool.</b> Remove the pan from the oven and have the cake cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave the cake until it is cool enough to touch.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-39.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-39.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 39" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-39.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-39.jpg" height="485" id="img_9087f2952b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9087f2952b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 39" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-39.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-39.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Frost and decorate.</b> Frost with <a href="/Make-Chocolate-Buttercream-Icing-(Frosting)" title="Make Chocolate Buttercream Icing (Frosting)">chocolate buttercream frosting</a> and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-40.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-40.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 40" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-40.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-40.jpg" height="485" id="img_73c3d2d580" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_73c3d2d580')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 40" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-40.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-40.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Serve and enjoy!</b> Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
<a name="qz_anchor_2"></a>
<div class="qz_container qz_desktop" id="qz_container_2">
<div class="qz_score">Score<br/><span class="qz_numerator">0</span> / <span class="qz_denominator">0</span>
</div>
<div class="qz_header">
<p>Method 5 Quiz</p>
<p class="qz_question">When do you add the xantham gum to the gluten-free cake batter?</p>
</div>
<form action="#" class="qz_form" target="_blank">
<div class="qz_section incorrect" id="quiz_2_0">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_2_0" name="quiz_2" type="radio"/><label for="radio_2_0">With the liquid ingredients.</label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Not quite! Xantham gum is a dry ingredient, so don't add it in with the liquids! However, if you forget to add it earlier in the process, it won't hurt your cake if you add it with the liquids. <span class="qz_addon">Choose another answer!</span></p>
</div>
<div class="qz_section incorrect" id="quiz_2_1">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_2_1" name="quiz_2" type="radio"/><label for="radio_2_1">At the very end, before it goes in the oven.</label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Not exactly! Xantham gum can be added well before the very end of your cake-baking process. If you forget and don't add it until the end, make sure it gets mixed all the way into the batter! <span class="qz_addon">Try again...</span></p>
</div>
<div class="qz_section correct" id="quiz_2_2">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_2_2" name="quiz_2" type="radio"/><label for="radio_2_2">With the dry ingredients.</label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Yep! Xantham gum should be added along with the other dry ingredients (gluten-free flour, cocoa powder, etc.). After you've added the liquid ingredients, stir until there are no more visible flour streaks. <span class="qz_addon">Read on for another quiz question.</span></p>
</div>
<div class="qz_section incorrect" id="quiz_2_3">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_2_3" name="quiz_2" type="radio"/><label for="radio_2_3">Only coat the pans with xantham gum, don't add it to the batter.</label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Definitely not! Not only will this not taste good, it will not help your cake at all! Make sure that if you flour the edges of your cake pans that you're using gluten-free flour. <span class="qz_addon">Pick another answer!</span></p>
</div>
</form>
<div class="wh_ad_inner hidden" data-adtargetid="quizad3" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div class="ad_label ad_label_dollar" id="quizad3"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('quizad3'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addQuizAd('quizad3')</script>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Vegan_Chocolate_Cake_2_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>6</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Vegan_Chocolate_Cake_2">Vegan Chocolate Cake</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_6">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-41.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-41.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 41" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-41.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-41.jpg" height="485" id="img_b65c02e19a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b65c02e19a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 41" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-41.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-41.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare to make the cake.</b> Preheat oven to 350° degrees Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-42-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-42-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 42" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-42-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-42-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_c1e5ce5c17" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c1e5ce5c17')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 42" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-42-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-42-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Combine the dry ingredients.</b> In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix using a whisk until the dry ingredients are well-combined.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-43.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-43.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 43" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-43.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-43.jpg" height="485" id="img_515e5a683f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_515e5a683f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 43" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-43.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-43.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add the wet ingredients.</b> Pour in the vegetable oil, vanilla extract, white vinegar, and water. Stir using a whisk or blend using a hand blender, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-44.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-44.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 44" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-44.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-44.jpg" height="485" id="img_e2e7988aad" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e2e7988aad')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 44" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-44.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-44.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pour batter into cake pans.</b> Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-45.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-45.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 45" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-45.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-45.jpg" height="485" id="img_ae9e1f79e4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ae9e1f79e4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 45" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-45.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-45.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Bake the cake.</b> Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 45 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-46-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-46-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 46" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-46-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-46-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_78433be5f6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_78433be5f6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 46" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-46-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-46-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Let the cake cool.</b> Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool for about twenty minutes on a wire rack. Leave both cakes until they are cool enough to touch.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-47-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-47-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 47" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-47-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-47-Version-2.jpg" height="485" id="img_f1b3428757" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f1b3428757')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 47" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-47-Version-2.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-47-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Frost and decorate.</b> Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with <a href="/Make-Chocolate-Buttercream-Icing-(Frosting)" title="Make Chocolate Buttercream Icing (Frosting)">chocolate buttercream frosting</a> and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg?ajax=true&aid=248948" href="#/Image:Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 48" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg" height="485" id="img_1946a4f7fd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1946a4f7fd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Chocolate Cake Step 48" class="whcdn content-fill" height="485" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg/aid248948-v4-728px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_6_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Serve and enjoy!</b> Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
<a name="qz_anchor_4"></a>
<div class="qz_container qz_desktop" id="qz_container_4">
<div class="qz_score">Score<br/><span class="qz_numerator">0</span> / <span class="qz_denominator">0</span>
</div>
<div class="qz_header">
<p>Method 6 Quiz</p>
<p class="qz_question">What is a good topping option for a vegan chocolate cake?</p>
</div>
<form action="#" class="qz_form" target="_blank">
<div class="qz_section incorrect" id="quiz_4_0">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_4_0" name="quiz_4" type="radio"/><label for="radio_4_0">Buttercream frosting</label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Not exactly! Since the cake is vegan, try to make the topping vegan, too! There are some recipes for buttercream frosting that substitute dairy for dairy-free products, so if you're set on buttercream frosting, make sure you are using one of those! <span class="qz_addon">Try again...</span></p>
</div>
<div class="qz_section correct" id="quiz_4_1">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_4_1" name="quiz_4" type="radio"/><label for="radio_4_1">Berries </label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Absolutely! Berries are a great choice for topping any cake, especially a vegan one. Make sure you rinse and thoroughly dry all berries before putting them on your cake! <span class="qz_addon">Read on for another quiz question.</span></p>
</div>
<div class="qz_section incorrect" id="quiz_4_2">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_4_2" name="quiz_4" type="radio"/><label for="radio_4_2">Whipped creram</label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Nope! If the cake itself is vegan, try to make the topping vegan, too! There are a couple of vegan whipped cream products available, but the texture and/or flavor might be slightly different than what you're used to. <span class="qz_addon">Click on another answer to find the right one...</span></p>
</div>
<div class="qz_section incorrect" id="quiz_4_3">
<input class="qz_radio" id="radio_4_3" name="quiz_4" type="radio"/><label for="radio_4_3">Carrots </label>
<p class="qz_explanation">Definitely not! Even if the intended recepient of the cake loves carrots, this would probably not taste very good! Consider a sweeter topping instead. <span class="qz_addon">Try again...</span></p>
</div>
</form>
<div class="wh_ad_inner hidden" data-adtargetid="quizad4" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="164829" data-caid="165702" data-cqid="164846" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="808085" data-submitter_id="2844222" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="14">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="35350" data-caid="36223" data-cqid="35367" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="63479" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="22" data-votes_up="57">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I substitute baking soda for baking powder and vice versa?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You can replace one with other, but you have to add some ingredients to make the chemical reaction the same and not affect your baked good.  If you want to create the equivalent of 1 teaspoon of baking powder out of baking soda, mix together ¼ teaspoon baking soda with ½ teaspoon cream of tartar and ¼ teaspoon cornstarch.  If you want to use baking powder instead of baking soda, simply use three times as much baking powder.</div>

<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="section variations sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Variations">Variations</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="variations">
<ul>
<li>
<a href="/Make-a-Spongy-Chocolate-Cake" title="Make a Spongy Chocolate Cake">Make an airy, spongy chocolate cake</a> as a light dessert.</li>
<li>
<a href="/Make-a-Dense-Chocolate-Cake" title="Make a Dense Chocolate Cake">Make a dense chocolate cake</a> if you want the dessert to be decadent and rich.</li>
<li>
<a href="/Make-Chocolate-and-Hazelnut-Praline-Cake" title="Make Chocolate and Hazelnut Praline Cake">Add a hazelnut praline twist to your chocolate cake</a> if you want something original.</li>
<li>Avoid baking by <a href="/Make-a-Chocolate-Biscuit-Cake" title="Make a Chocolate Biscuit Cake">making a chocolate biscuit cake</a>.</li>
<li>Out of frosting? Try a <a href="/Make-a-Chocolate-Chip-Cake" title="Make a Chocolate Chip Cake">chocolate chip cake</a>!</li>
<li>
<a href="/Make-a-Walnut-Chocolate-Bread-Cake" title="Make a Walnut Chocolate Bread Cake">Make a walnut chocolate bread cake</a> to enjoy with afternoon tea.</li>
<li>Go for the crunch with a chocolate covered Oreo cookie cake.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Use half or double the amount of ingredients for a smaller or larger cake, respectively.</li>
<li>Consider adding some edible decorations like chocolate chips, cream flowers or beads, etc.</li>
<li>If eggs are being used, whip the yolks and fold them in first and then whip the whites and fold them in in the end.</li>
<li>Don't cut the cake or even try to remove it from the baking pan unless it has been cooled for minimum of 5 minutes. Preferably, leave it to cool completely. Only cut or try to remove it from the baking pan before it is completely if there is a big issue with time or if your cake is supposed to be served warm.</li>
<li>If you want a softer cake, add more baking powder.</li>
<li>Some people are vegetarians and do not eat eggs, so you will need to prepare Eggless cakes for them. Many people even don’t like having sour cream or butter. So what you can do is have some substitutes in place of the eggs like rice flour. However, if you use rice flour, be prepared for the cake batter to remain thin.</li>
<li>Want to know if your cake is baked? Put a toothpick in the center. If the batter comes out dry the cake is fully baked. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Add flour to the bottom of the pan. So that the cake comes out easily.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To make a basic chocolate cake, sift together flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Next, stir eggs, vegetable oil, sour cream, and vanilla extract into your dry mixture and mixed until everything is just combined. Pour the mixture into an 8 inch round pan that’s been coated with grease and dusted with flour. Finally, bake your cake at 350 °F for 30 minutes. <span id="summary_last_sentence">Read the article to learn how to make a gluten-free or vegan chocolate cake!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

    "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
    "@type": "HowTo",
    "headline": "Make a Chocolate Cake",
    "name": "Make a Chocolate Cake",
    "mainEntityOfPage": {
        "@type": "WebPage",
        "id": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake"
    },
    "image": {
        "@type": "ImageObject",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg\/aid248948-v4-1200px-Make-a-Chocolate-Cake-Step-48.jpg",
        "width": 1200,
        "height": 800
    },
    "author": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,

        "sameAs": [

            "https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/company\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/user\/WikiHow"
        ]
    },
    "aggregateRating": {
        "@type": "AggregateRating",
        "bestRating": 100,
        "ratingCount": 16,
        "ratingValue": 73
    },
    "datePublished": "2007-11-23",
    "dateModified": "2019-03-29",
    "publisher": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },
        "sameAs": [
            "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/wikiHow\/",
            "https:\/\/twitter.com\/wikiHow",
            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",

    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Basic Chocolate Cake",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Sift the dry ingredients together. The dry ingredients are the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Place all the dry ingredients in a sifter and shake it back and forth over a bowl to eliminate the clumps."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stir in the liquid ingredients and mix well. These are the eggs, vegetable oil, sour cream, and vanilla extract. Some people like to add these ingredients individually, but others stir them together in a second bowl and before adding them to the dry ingredients."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Grease and flour an 8 inch round pan. Slowly pour the cake batter in. Make sure to get every bit of the batter into the pan."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Bake at 350\u00a0\u00b0F (177\u00a0\u00b0C) for 30 minutes."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Let the cake cool for five minutes."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Wait until the cake is completely cool. Then you may frost or decorate as desired. Enjoy!"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Moist & Fluffy Chocolate Cake",
            "position": 2,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare to make the cake. Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0 Fahrenheit or 162\u00b0 Celsius. Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Mix the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cocoa powder, and sugar. Mix until the dry ingredients are properly folded in."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add the coffee, oil, and buttermilk. Pour in the hot coffee, canola oil, and buttermilk into the dry ingredients. Mix using a whisk or hand blender, until the ingredients resemble a light brown cake batter."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add the eggs and vanilla. Crack in the eggs and pour in the vanilla extract into the cake batter. Mix one last time until there are no more flour streaks and the chocolate cake batter is slightly thick."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pour batter into the cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about an hour, until the cake rises and is fluffy. Check to see if the cake is ready by sticking a small knife in the middle. If it comes out clean, it is fully baked."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave them until they are cool enough to touch."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and\/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 9,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Eggless Chocolate Cake",
            "position": 3,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350\u00b0 degrees Fahrenheit or 176\u00b0 Celsius. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Sift the dry ingredients except the sugar. In a large bowl, sift the flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, and baking soda with a whisk. Mix until properly combined."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add the sugar. Carefully pour in the sugar into the dry ingredients. Mix again with the whisk until the sugar combines in with the dry ingredients."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Fold in the wet ingredients. Pour in the vegetable oil, water, and vanilla extract into the dry ingredients. Stir with a whisk or a hand blender until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pour the batter into the pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Bake the cake. Place the cake pan in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about an hour, until the cake rises and is fluffy."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Let the cake cool. Remove the pan from the oven and have the cake cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave the cake until it is cool enough to touch."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Frost and decorate. Frost with chocolate chocolate buttercream frosting and\/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 9,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Milkless Chocolate Cake",
            "position": 4,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350\u00b0 degrees Fahrenheit or 176\u00b0 Celsius. Grease and flour two 9-inch cake pans."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Mix the ingredients with a whisk and then form a well in the middle of the bowl."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the soy or almond milk, vinegar, eggs, brewed coffee, and dairy-free sour cream into the well. Use a blender to mix for about two minutes until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pour batter into cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 30-40 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool for about twenty minutes on a wire rack. Leave both cakes until they are cool enough to touch."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and\/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Gluten-Free Chocolate Cake",
            "position": 5,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350\u00b0 degrees Fahrenheit or 176\u00b0 Celsius. Grease and flour a 9-inch square pan."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, mix the gluten-free flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, and xanthan gum. Stir with a whisk until well-combined."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the cooking oil, vinegar, vanilla extract, water, and egg. Mix well with the whisk or use a hand-mixer and blend until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pour the batter into the pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Bake the cake. Place the cake pan in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 30-35 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Let the cake cool. Remove the pan from the oven and have the cake cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave the cake until it is cool enough to touch."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Frost and decorate. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and\/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Vegan Chocolate Cake",
            "position": 6,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350\u00b0 degrees Fahrenheit or 176\u00b0 Celsius. Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix using a whisk until the dry ingredients are well-combined."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the vegetable oil, vanilla extract, white vinegar, and water. Stir using a whisk or blend using a hand blender, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pour batter into cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 45 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool for about twenty minutes on a wire rack. Leave both cakes until they are cool enough to touch."
                    }

title: How to Make a Chocolate Cake
content_html:
Sift the dry ingredients together. The dry ingredients are the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Place all the dry ingredients in a sifter and shake it back and forth over a bowl to eliminate the clumps.
Stir in the liquid ingredients and mix well. These are the eggs, vegetable oil, sour cream, and vanilla extract. Some people like to add these ingredients individually, but others stir them together in a second bowl and before adding them to the dry ingredients.
Grease and flour an 8 inch round pan. Slowly pour the cake batter in. Make sure to get every bit of the batter into the pan.
Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 30 minutes.
Let the cake cool for five minutes.
Wait until the cake is completely cool. Then you may frost or decorate as desired. Enjoy!
Prepare to make the cake. Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit or 162° Celsius. Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.
Mix the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cocoa powder, and sugar. Mix until the dry ingredients are properly folded in.
Add the coffee, oil, and buttermilk. Pour in the hot coffee, canola oil, and buttermilk into the dry ingredients. Mix using a whisk or hand blender, until the ingredients resemble a light brown cake batter.
Add the eggs and vanilla. Crack in the eggs and pour in the vanilla extract into the cake batter. Mix one last time until there are no more flour streaks and the chocolate cake batter is slightly thick.
Pour batter into the cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.
Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about an hour, until the cake rises and is fluffy. Check to see if the cake is ready by sticking a small knife in the middle. If it comes out clean, it is fully baked.
Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave them until they are cool enough to touch.
Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles
Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!
Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350° degrees Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan.
Sift the dry ingredients except the sugar. In a large bowl, sift the flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, and baking soda with a whisk. Mix until properly combined.
Add the sugar. Carefully pour in the sugar into the dry ingredients. Mix again with the whisk until the sugar combines in with the dry ingredients.
Fold in the wet ingredients. Pour in the vegetable oil, water, and vanilla extract into the dry ingredients. Stir with a whisk or a hand blender until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.
Pour the batter into the pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.
Bake the cake. Place the cake pan in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about an hour, until the cake rises and is fluffy.
Let the cake cool. Remove the pan from the oven and have the cake cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave the cake until it is cool enough to touch.
Frost and decorate. Frost with chocolate chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles.
Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!
Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350° degrees Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. Grease and flour two 9-inch cake pans.
Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Mix the ingredients with a whisk and then form a well in the middle of the bowl.
Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the soy or almond milk, vinegar, eggs, brewed coffee, and dairy-free sour cream into the well. Use a blender to mix for about two minutes until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.
Pour batter into cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.
Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 30-40 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy.
Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool for about twenty minutes on a wire rack. Leave both cakes until they are cool enough to touch.
Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles
Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!
Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350° degrees Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. Grease and flour a 9-inch square pan.
Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, mix the gluten-free flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, and xanthan gum. Stir with a whisk until well-combined.
Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the cooking oil, vinegar, vanilla extract, water, and egg. Mix well with the whisk or use a hand-mixer and blend until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.
Pour the batter into the pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.
Bake the cake. Place the cake pan in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 30-35 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy.
Let the cake cool. Remove the pan from the oven and have the cake cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave the cake until it is cool enough to touch.
Frost and decorate. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles.
Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!
Prepare to make the cake. Preheat oven to 350° degrees Fahrenheit or 176° Celsius. Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix using a whisk until the dry ingredients are well-combined.
Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the vegetable oil, vanilla extract, white vinegar, and water. Stir using a whisk or blend using a hand blender, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.
Pour batter into cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.
Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 45 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy.
Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool for about twenty minutes on a wire rack. Leave both cakes until they are cool enough to touch.
Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles
Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!
